result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Summerkamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law, within 60 days of release from Racine County Jail and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 15 days. May serve in Walworth County. 45 days are stayed.

AMENDED: Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.

Defendant Brian J Summerkamp in court with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have reviewed the PSI and all documents submitted by defense. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends w/held sent - 3 yrs probation.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ****MODIFIED 3/19/15 TO ALLOW CONTACT W/DM. ****  No contact with the co-defendant, DM. Defendant can not discuss the case w/YAS.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on May 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.

Defendant Brian J Summerkamp in court with attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond condition modification. State does not object. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond conditions are modified to allow contact w/ DM. All other conditions remain.
